title: Case Residuals Computation
text: technical appendix outlining data used generate plots computed.

title: Case Residuals Computation
text: function casewise_residual() first identifies \(x\) variables: variables point least one variable, \(y\) variables, variables least one variable pointing . Note variable can sets variables (e.g., mediator). enumerates pairwise combination \(x\) \(y\) variables see following cases belong :

title: Case Residuals Computation
text: path free, fixed non-zero, residuals \(x\) \(y\) computed predicting variables predict \(y\) model. regression coefficients computed \[ \beta_{x} = \Sigma_{x0}^{-1}\Sigma_{(x0, x)}, \] \[ \beta_{y} = \Sigma_{x0}^{-1}\Sigma_{(x0, y)}, \] \(\Sigma_{x0}\) model-implied covariance \(x0\), variables predict \(y\), \(\Sigma_{(x0, x)}\) column vector model-implied covariance \(x\) \(x0\). Similarly, \(\Sigma_{(x0, y)}\) column vector model-implied covariance \(y\) \(x0\). predicted values \(x\) \(y\), \(\hat{X}\) \(\hat{Y}\), respectively, computed \[ \hat{X} = X\beta_{x}, \] \[ \hat{Y} = Y\beta_{y}. \] \(X\) \(Y\) column vectors values \(x\) \(y\). residuals \(x\) \(y\) computed: \[ E_{x} = X - \hat{X}, \] \[ E_{y} = Y - \hat{Y}. \] , computed multiple regression although model-implied covariance matrix used compute regression coefficient. Simple standardized residuals (standardized standard deviations, without correction studentized residuals multiple regression) also stored.

title: Case Residuals Computation
text: path fixed zero, add_path FALSE (default), casewise_residuals() nothing. add_path TRUE, \(y\) variable point \(x\) model[^prevents adding bidirectional path], add path \(x\) \(y\) fit model . residuals \(x\) \(y\) computed free paths model stored. Note done simply adding y ~ x model. Functions like lavaan::sem() may fix free parameters model fitted may differ original model one degree freedom. purpose step purely exploration.

title: Case Residuals Computation
text: \(x\) \(y\) variable, residuals \(y\) predicted variables pointing computed stored, using regression coefficients model.

title: Case Residuals Computation
text: Note residuals model based lack adjustments usually done multiple regression. knowledge, adjustments extended path analysis. Nevertheless, residuals still useful graphical assessment linearity identification unusual cases respect model.

what: Load the Package and Fit a Path Model
title: Get Started
code: library(semdplot) # A sample dataset from semdplot dat <- data_pa  library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-13 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. mod <- " m11 ~ a11*x1 + a21*x2 + c1 + c2 m12 ~ b12*m11 + c1 + c2 m21 ~ a12*x1 + a22*x2 + c1 + c2 m22 ~ b22*m21 + c1 + c2 y1 ~ b12y1*m12 + c1 + c2 y2 ~ b22y2*m22 + c1 + c2 ind_1 := a11*b12*b12y1 ind_2 := a21*b22*b22y2 " fit <- sem(mod, dat) summary(fit, fit.measures = TRUE) #> lavaan 0.6.13 ended normally after 7 iterations #>  #>   Estimator                                         ML #>   Optimization method                           NLMINB #>   Number of model parameters                        27 #>  #>   Number of observations                           200 #>  #> Model Test User Model: #>                                                        #>   Test statistic                                76.709 #>   Degrees of freedom                                18 #>   P-value (Chi-square)                           0.000 #>  #> Model Test Baseline Model: #>  #>   Test statistic                               377.440 #>   Degrees of freedom                                39 #>   P-value                                        0.000 #>  #> User Model versus Baseline Model: #>  #>   Comparative Fit Index (CFI)                    0.827 #>   Tucker-Lewis Index (TLI)                       0.624 #>  #> Loglikelihood and Information Criteria: #>  #>   Loglikelihood user model (H0)              -1709.158 #>   Loglikelihood unrestricted model (H1)      -1670.803 #>                                                        #>   Akaike (AIC)                                3472.315 #>   Bayesian (BIC)                              3561.370 #>   Sample-size adjusted Bayesian (SABIC)       3475.831 #>  #> Root Mean Square Error of Approximation: #>  #>   RMSEA                                          0.128 #>   90 Percent confidence interval - lower         0.099 #>   90 Percent confidence interval - upper         0.158 #>   P-value H_0: RMSEA <= 0.050                    0.000 #>   P-value H_0: RMSEA >= 0.080                    0.996 #>  #> Standardized Root Mean Square Residual: #>  #>   SRMR                                           0.090 #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                             Standard #>   Information                                 Expected #>   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>   m11 ~                                                #>     x1       (a11)    0.543    0.066    8.202    0.000 #>     x2       (a21)    0.572    0.069    8.345    0.000 #>     c1                0.258    0.070    3.701    0.000 #>     c2                0.460    0.074    6.213    0.000 #>   m12 ~                                                #>     m11      (b12)    0.290    0.055    5.246    0.000 #>     c1                0.165    0.073    2.269    0.023 #>     c2                0.185    0.079    2.322    0.020 #>   m21 ~                                                #>     x1       (a12)   -0.068    0.066   -1.027    0.304 #>     x2       (a22)    0.184    0.069    2.678    0.007 #>     c1               -0.011    0.070   -0.158    0.874 #>     c2               -0.138    0.074   -1.861    0.063 #>   m22 ~                                                #>     m21      (b22)    0.249    0.076    3.274    0.001 #>     c1                0.031    0.076    0.405    0.685 #>     c2               -0.023    0.082   -0.280    0.780 #>   y1 ~                                                 #>     m12     (b121)    0.442    0.070    6.267    0.000 #>     c1               -0.041    0.078   -0.525    0.599 #>     c2               -0.053    0.084   -0.636    0.525 #>   y2 ~                                                 #>     m22     (b222)    0.511    0.065    7.822    0.000 #>     c1                0.210    0.072    2.895    0.004 #>     c2               -0.027    0.077   -0.350    0.727 #>  #> Covariances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>  .y1 ~~                                                #>    .y2                0.028    0.075    0.377    0.706 #>  #> Variances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>    .m11               0.928    0.093   10.000    0.000 #>    .m12               0.987    0.099   10.000    0.000 #>    .m21               0.930    0.093   10.000    0.000 #>    .m22               1.118    0.112   10.000    0.000 #>    .y1                1.115    0.112   10.000    0.000 #>    .y2                1.005    0.101   10.000    0.000 #>  #> Defined Parameters: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>     ind_1             0.070    0.019    3.612    0.000 #>     ind_2             0.073    0.026    2.840    0.005

title: Get Started
text: function casewise_residuals() can used compute necessary residuals (please refer vignettes("casewise_residuals") computation):

what: Plot Partial Plots and Residual Plots for Selected Variables
title: Get Started
text: output casewise_residuals() plot() method. Simply use plot() can produce plots. necessary, users can use x_names y_names set \(x\) \(y\) variables included:  output ggplot2 plot. can customized. Please refer plot.semdplot_residuals() options.

what: If A Path Does Not Exist, Add It
title: Get Started
text: paths model added, residuals can computed fitting model path added. done calling casewise_residuals() set add_path `TRUE: residuals computed, plotted plot.semdplot_residuals():
code: fit_res_add <- casewise_residuals(fit, add_path = TRUE) p2 <- plot(fit_res_add,            x_names = c("x1", "x2", "m11", "m12", "m21"),            y_names = c("m11", "m12", "m21", "m22", "y1", "y2")) plot(p2)

title: Get Started
text: follow code just illustrates plot fewer variables:

title: Get Started
code: p2 <- plot(fit_res_add,            x_names = c("x1", "m11", "m12"),            y_names = c("y1", "y2")) plot(p2)

what: Use a Named Vector to Change Variable Names in the Plots
title: Get Started
code: p2 <- plot(fit_res_add,            x_names = c(IV1 = "x1", Med1 = "m11", Med2 = "m12"),            y_names = c(DV1 = "y1", DV2 = "y2")) plot(p2)

title: Get Started
text: example also illustrates change style. Note , ggplot2 functions used changing aesthetics, users need load ggplot2 first, e.g., rel().
code: library(ggplot2) p2 <- plot(fit_res_add,            x_names = "x1",            y_names = "m11",            partial_point_aes = list(size = 4,                                     color = "blue"),            partial_reg_aes = list(size = 10),            partial_loess_aes = list(color = "black",                                     linetype = "dashed"),            partial_b_aes = list(size = rel(10))) plot(p2)

title: Get Started
text: setting = "residual", plot() method can produce plots residuals endogenous variables:  Users can also use y_names select endogenous variables plot:
code: p <- plot(fit_res_add,           what = "residual") plot(p) p <- plot(fit_res_add,           what = "residual",           y_names = c("m11", "m12")) print(p)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shu Fai Cheung. Author, maintainer. Mark Hok Chio Lai. Author. Rongwei Sun. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cheung S, Lai M, Sun R (2023). semdplot: Diagnostic Plots Structural Equation Models. R package version 0.0.0.9002.
code: @Manual{,   title = {semdplot: Diagnostic Plots for Structural Equation Models},   author = {Shu Fai Cheung and Mark Hok Chio Lai and Rongwei Sun},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9002}, }

what: Diagnostic Plots for Structural Equation Models
title: Diagnostic Plots for Structural Equation Models
text: package generating diagnostic plots structural equation modeling (SEM).

title: Diagnostic Plots for Structural Equation Models
text: package still experimental. Please install now. want try experimental work--progress version, can install : Suggestions also welcomed: https://github.com/sfcheung/semdplot/issues

title: Casewise Residuals — casewise_residuals
text: computes casewise residuals used plot functions.

title: Casewise Residuals — casewise_residuals
text: fit output structural equation model analysis. support output lavaan::sem() now. add_path Logical. path model (fixed zero), whether path added model #' compute residuals. Default FALSE. Use necessary model fitted path.

title: Casewise Residuals — casewise_residuals
text: semdplot_residuals-class object. TODO: Write methods class.

title: Casewise Residuals — casewise_residuals
text: receives output structural equation model analysis (e.g, output lavaan::sem()) computes casewise residuals. currently supports output lavaan::sem() single-sample model observable variables .

what: Sample Data: A Path Model — data_pa
title: Sample Data: A Path Model — data_pa
text: 10-variable dataset 200 cases.

title: Sample Data: A Path Model — data_pa
Sample Data: A Path Model — data_pa
text: data frame 200 rows 10 variables: m11 Mediator. Numeric. m12 Mediator. Numeric. m21 Mediator. Numeric. m22 Mediator. Numeric. y1 Outcome variable. Numeric. y2 Outcome variable. Numeric. x1 Predictor. Numeric. x2 Predictor. Numeric. c1 Control variable. Numeric. c2 Control variable. Numeric.

title: Sample Data: A Path Model — data_pa
code: library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-13 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. data(data_pa) mod <- " m11 ~ a11*x1 + a21*x2 + c1 + c2 m12 ~ b12*m11 + c1 + c2 m21 ~ a12*x1 + a22*x2 + c1 + c2 m22 ~ b22*m21 + c1 + c2 y1 ~ b12y1*m12 + c1 + c2 y2 ~ b22y2*m22 + c1 + c2 ind_1 := a11*b12*b12y1 ind_2 := a21*b22*b22y2 " fit <- sem(mod, data_pa) summary(fit, fit.measures = TRUE) #> lavaan 0.6.13 ended normally after 7 iterations #>  #>   Estimator title: Residual Plot Matrix — plot.semdplot_residuals
text: plot method semdplot_residuals-class object. generates residual plots based output casewise_residuals().

title: Residual Plot Matrix — plot.semdplot_residuals
code: # S3 method for semdplot_residuals plot(   x,   what = c("partial", "residual"),   x_names = NULL,   y_names = NULL,   same_x_range = TRUE,   same_y_range = TRUE,   partial_point_aes = list(),   partial_loess_aes = list(),   partial_reg_aes = list(),   partial_b_aes = list(),   partial_theme_aes = list(),   added_point_aes = list(),   added_loess_aes = list(),   added_reg_aes = list(),   added_b_aes = list(),   added_theme_aes = list(),   resid_hist_aes = list(),   resid_density_aes = list(),   resid_theme_aes = list(),   resid_ellipse_aes = list(),   text_nopath = "--",   output_type = c("plot", "list"),   ... )

title: Residual Plot Matrix — plot.semdplot_residuals
text: x semdplot_residuals-class object, output casewise_residuals(). Named x required plot method. String. plot. Can "partial" "residual". "partial", default, matrix partial plots /plots residuals plotted. "residual", plots residuals y-variable plotted. x_names Character vector. x-variables. vector named, names used instead variable names plots. y_names Character vector. y-variables. vector named, names used instead variable names plots. same_x_range Whether plots range x-axis. Default TRUE. same_y_range Whether plots range y-axis, except plots residuals. Default TRUE. partial_point_aes list argument ggplot2::geom_point(). Used modify default aesthetics points partial plot. partial_loess_aes list argument ggplot2::geom_line() loess line. Used modify default aesthetics line partial plot. partial_reg_aes list argument ggplot2::geom_line() regression line. Used modify default aesthetics line partial plot. partial_b_aes list argument ggplot2::annotate() standardized regression coefficient. Used modify default aesthetics text partial plot. partial_theme_aes list argument ggplot2::theme() partial plots. Used modify default theme partial plot. added_point_aes list argument ggplot2::geom_point(). Used modify default aesthetics points added-variable plot. added_loess_aes list argument ggplot2::geom_line() loess line. Used modify default aesthetics line added-variable plot. added_reg_aes list argument ggplot2::geom_line() regression line. Used modify default aesthetics line added-variable plot. added_b_aes list argument ggplot2::annotate() standardized regression coefficient. Used modify default aesthetics text added-variable plot. added_theme_aes list argument ggplot2::theme() added-variable plots. Used modify default theme added-variable plot. resid_hist_aes list arguments ggplot2::geom_histogram() plot residuals. Use modify default aesthetics histogram. resid_density_aes list arguments ggplot2::geom_density() plot residuals. Use modify default aesthetics density plot. resid_theme_aes list argument ggplot2::theme() plots residuals. Used modify default theme plot residual. resid_ellipse_aes list arguments ggplot2::stat_ellipse() plot residuals. Use modify default aesthetics ellipse. text_nopath String. Text display empty cells. Default `"--". output_type type output. "plot", default, plots processed patchwork::wrap_plots(). "list", list plots returned. ... Additional arguments. used.

title: Residual Plot Matrix — plot.semdplot_residuals
text: ggplot2 plot, list ggplot2 plots.

title: semdplot 0.0.0.9002
text: Work--Progress! first crude draft, proof--concept. (0.0.0.9001) Remove GGally dependence plot_resid(). Plots residuals done internally using ggplot2. (0.0.0.9002)
